protocol.title: Workflow for generating HMW plant DNA for third generation sequencing with high N50 and high accuracy
protocol.title_html: Workflow for generating HMW plant DNA for third generation sequencing with high N50 and high accuracy

source.description: In a tray add excess liquid nitrogen to mortar and pestle. Allow most of the liquid nitrogen to evaporate and bring mortar and pestle down to cryogenic temperatures.

Grind > 1 g of frozen leaves to a very fine powder in mortar and pestle.
  • Add small amounts of liquid nitrogen, as necessary, to maintain sample, and mortar and pestle at cryogenic temperatures.
  • Resuspending powder in a small amount of liquid nitrogen is also very effective for pouring and transferring samples to storage tubes.
Process sample straight away using below protocol or return to -80°C for storage.
For best results use leaves that have been dark-treated for > 48 hours, freshly picked, weighed, flash frozen in liquid nitrogen and stored at -80°C

Add the Lysis buffer to the ground powder depending on quantity and type of columns to be used for purification.
  • Resuspend by inverting gently end-over-end
  • Dispense to multiple tubes if necessary.

Add Proteinase K
per 100/G column or
per 500/G column

Incubate > 3.5 h at 50°C with slow rocking. Place the tube with a slight tilt so that the liquid moves very slightly during rotations.
  • Note: The tube can easily leak, check the tube condition periodically
  • We use a platform rocker in a preheated incubator/shaker (with NO SHAKING)

Preheat buffer QF in falcon tube in a
waterbath:
per 100/G column or
per 500/G column
Take the lysed samples from the incubator

Centrifuge the 50ml tubes containing the samples for 15 minutes at room temp at maximum speed (3220g / 4000 rpm) with acceleration and deceleration at maximum (=9)
  • After centrifugation minimal debris should be in the supernatant
  • If large amounts of debris still present repeat centrifugation up to 15 min
Pour the supernatant in the pre-calibrated Genomic tip column and allow the supernatant to pass through the column.

Add 1 ml of wash buffer QC by running along the walls of the tubes in order to precipitate any debris stuck on the walls. Remove the debris from the bottom by aspirating
If debris still present wash with another
of QC buffer

Wash the column twice with buffer QC:
2 x
of buffer QC 100/G column.
2 x
of buffer QC 500/G column.
Transfer the column to a clean 50 ml Falcon tube.

Elute with elution buffer QF previously pre-heated at 50°C
of buffer QF per 100/G column
of buffer QF per 500/G column

Remove column and precipitate the DNA by adding 2-propanol (isopropanol) along the wall of the tube:
per 100/G column
per 500/G column

Mix gently by slowly inverting the tube to form a visible mass of HMW DNA floating in solution (a “jellyfish”)
  • You should observe the formation of the jellyfish during the process of inverting the tubes.
  • Once the pellet HMW DNA is compacted slightly, stop mixing.
  • Note: If the jellyfish is not formed, proceed to Precipitation of DNA with cold centrifugation (see below).
  • Note: If the jellyfish is not formed, proceed to Precipitation of DNA with cold centrifugation (see below).

Capture the pellet HMW DNA with a disposable inoculation loop.
  • This can be difficult and the pellet can easily be lost during transfers between tubes
  • Try to trap the DNA pellet in the centre of the loop.

Transfer the DNA on the loop to a 1.5ml tube containing
of fresh 80% ethanol.
  • This step should remove starch and improve the quality of the DNA.
  • Use separate tubes of ethanol for different samples
Soak for 1 min
Air dry for 30 seconds approximately
Repeat twice more in two separate tubes of 80% ethanol
Air dry the DNA pellet for 30-60 seconds allowing most of the ethanol to evaporate

Dissolve DNA pellet in
to
of TE buffer in a new 1.5ml tube.
  • Cut off the end of the loop with scissors
  • Volume of TE can be modified according to the amount of estimated DNA (size of the pellet)
  • Several pellets can be combined
Leave overnight at room temperature to allow resuspension of the DNA.

Remove loop and carefully homogenize the DNA solution with wide bore tips. Use slow aspiration and discharge: 3 seconds up and 3 seconds down.
  • DNA should be into solution; look for a clear solution
  • If DNA is still not resuspended continue with resuspension
  • Resuspension on a slow shaker or incubation at 4°C
  • Don’t apply heat (even 37°C can degrade HMW DNA)

Quantify the DNA and check the quality
  • Use ds BR Qubit assay for DNA quantification
  • Use Nanodrop to check the quality:
  • A 260/280 ratio of 1.8-2.0 and 260/230 ratio of 2.0-2.2 is ideal
  • This measures contamination with carbohydrates and other contaminants. The 260/230 ratio must be > 2 as sugars disrupt the polymerase during sequencing.
  • Use Nanodrop to check the quality:
  • A 260/280 ratio of 1.8-2.0 and 260/230 ratio of 2.0-2.2 is ideal
  • This measures contamination with carbohydrates and other contaminants. The 260/230 ratio must be > 2 as sugars disrupt the polymerase during sequencing.
- If 260/230 is low proceed with a gentle AMPure PB Bead clean and re-do the Nanodrop. Only very high molecular weight DNA is lost.
Run Pulse Field Gel Electrophoresis or FEMTO Pulse analysis of your DNA to check the size distribution of DNA.

The following protocol is based on the "QIAGEN Genomic DNA Handbook" available at www.qiagen.com. We follow the recommendations for tissue with modifications.
For 1 g of ground leaf tissue prepare enough Lysis Buffer for 4 x 100/G, or 1-2 x 500/G tip columns.

Calibrate the 100/G or 500/G columns
  • Put the column inside the placolumneeve on top of a 50ml Falcon tube (see figure in Supplementary section)
  • Calibrate the column with the calibration buffer QBT:
  • Add
  • of buffer QBT per 100/G column
  • Add
  • of buffer QBT per 500/G column
  • All QBT needs to go through the column. This step is quite quick
Add
of buffer QBT per 100/G column
Add
of buffer QBT per 500/G column

source.title: Precipitation of DNA with cold centrifugation (Optional)

source.description:
Note: If a jellyfish of DNA was not present after addition of 2-propanol
this may indicate a poor quality extraction, dependent on species of plant, and a re-extraction may be appropriate.

source.description:
Resuspend in TE buffer
Continue with resuspension and quality control of extracted DNA

Pulse Field Gel Electrophoresis
  • 1% agarose TBE gel over 24 hours (Initial switch 1 sec, finial switch 25 sec, 6 volt/cm, 120° included angle, Chef III, Bio-Rad, Hercules, CA, USA)
  • Midrange PFG and Lambda PFG markers (N0342S, N0341S, NEB, Ipswich, MA, USA).
FEMTO Pulse analysis

materials.name: Coors™ porcelain mortar Coorstek 60316 capacity 145 mL O.D. × H 90 mm × 70 mm

description: We have developed a method based on the Qiagen Genomics-Tip kit for the extraction of HMW DNA from a wide range of plants suitable for third generation sequencing platforms such as PacBio and Oxford Nanopore. This HMW plant DNA was used to make sequencing libraries with high insert N50 (30-40 Kb) for GridION and PromethION Oxford Nanopore machines and Sequel I and Sequel II PacBio machines. This HMW DNA is also suitable for PacBio HiFi libraries. The resulting sequencing data is ideally suited for de novo assembly of plant genomes.
